name: Historic Center & Miguel Hidalgo Plaza
description: The heart of Tequisquiapan. A lively place with its central kiosk, colonial arches, and a peaceful atmosphere. Perfect for walking and enjoying local cuisine.
alt: Miguel Hidalgo Plaza in the center of Tequisquiapan with its kiosk and arches

name: Santa María de la Asunción Parish
description: A beautiful neoclassical church with a distinctive pink dome visible from almost anywhere in town. Its pink quarry stone facade is stunning.
alt: Facade of the Santa María de la Asunción Parish in Tequisquiapan

name: La Redonda Vineyards
description: Just a few minutes from the center, this vineyard is a pioneer in the region. It offers tours to learn about winemaking, tastings, and cultural events throughout the year.
alt: Fields of vines at La Redonda Vineyards near Tequisquiapan

name: Tequisquiapan Opal Mines
description: A unique adventure where you can explore an open-pit mine, learn about the extraction of opal, a semi-precious stone, and even search for your own gem.
alt: View of an open-pit opal mine in Tequisquiapan

name: Craft Market
description: An ideal place to find souvenirs and local art. It specializes in wicker and rod products, such as baskets, furniture, and ornaments, all handmade by local artisans.
alt: Stall with wicker baskets and crafts in Tequisquiapan

name: La Pila Park
description: An oasis of tranquility ideal for families. It features green areas, playgrounds, a small lake, and the centuries-old ahuehuete tree that gives it its name, next to the water pile that supplied the town.
alt: Historic water pile within the lush La Pila Park in Tequisquiapan
